content: Hey! What are everyone's favorite websites (landing pages)? What are your go-to's for examples of clean navigation, good layouts, etc.?
probably not what you're looking for, but https://www.mcmaster.com/ is pretty dang famous for usability
Heh, rather different from what I had in mind, but a good reference nonetheless. :)
I like https://python-poetry.org/ because of the simple yet beautiful animations. Though for a webapp like Zulip (which has different purposes), it may not be an ideal comparison.
Cool! I'm actually thinking about the zulip.com site, so that definitely works as a reference. :)
To use that as a bad example - animations would drive me away unless they're short and to the point. The one on the poetry page is still going, and slowly (here).

Alya Abbott said:

Hey! What are everyone's favorite websites (landing pages)? What are your go-to's for examples of clean navigation, good layouts, etc.?

Not my favorite, but right now this one is coming in my mind https://barba.js.org/
I like the simplicity of that. I'm not sure if we'd have a "can we help you" widget, but it's quite distracting.
Those widgets can be really useful, especially if you (like Hubspot) have an expensive product and want to talk to as many customers as possible interactively as part of your sales strategy.
I'm sure they have worth, but it popped up with no warning over... maybe 1/4 of the page width, from memory?

1) https://www.wonder.me/. A bit generic, but simple, clean and still pretty. Nice app too.

2) https://cordova.apache.org/. This has has a subtle gradation of the dark background. It is also simple, with no moving bits, which can be distracting. Generally, I like a colored background that fills in the entire page (like Zulip's dark mode - would love to see a dark blue version).

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

https://www.hubspot.com/

one of the best
All the mentioned sites look good, but they all look the same somehow, except for https://www.mcmaster.com/ that has its own personality.
